comments.body: Not necessary in this PR, but I'd like to see very descriptive comments on all of these objects. It was a little hard for me to understand what was going on here when I joined the team, and having descriptive comments on these would have been really helpful.
This is only a first-pass to demonstrate my intent.  The next step is rewriting the generic synch controller for maintainability and testability.

Apologies for the delay in checking this.
I have only one main comment. I see that this code has already gone into review and multiple revisions.
I believe u have made these changes within secret_controller.go itself for the people to appreciate the diff between the generic code and the existing controller code and some follow up PR will rename/move this to a generic named file. Right? 
The ```FederationSyncController {... }``` and the related code ideally should go into a common file, probably with unit test also moved suitably for the common code. I guess it will be better that this is merged in that shape when it is merged. (I am also quite fine, if this is merged as is and that change follows).
I personally like this overall and appreciate this contribution..
Additionally, I think @mwielgus might be interested in looking into this, with his wider understanding of controllers and informers, and since he self assigned this.

Yes, this is just the start of the work.  There was initially concern that the approach would require an extensive design, and this PR was an attempt to make the intended approach clear.

This is a strict refactor - there are no functional changes - so I'm not sure @mwielgus's attention is required.  I hear he has his hands full with non-federation responsibilities.

cool, as I said, I think its still great the way it is as now. :)
and I think bot needs both approve and lgtm.
/lgtm
I really dislike arbitrary constants buried deep in code like this.  Sins of the past, I realize, but ...

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +124,128 @@
	s := &FederationSyncController{
		reviewDelay:           time.Second * 10,
		clusterAvailableDelay: time.Second * 20,
		smallDelay:            time.Second * 3,

comments.body: Nit: I'm not a fan of single character variable names. 'controller' rather?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +123,127 @@	recorder := broadcaster.NewRecorder(api.Scheme, clientv1.EventSource{Component: fmt.Sprintf("federated-%v-controller", adapter.Kind())})

	s := &FederationSyncController{
		reviewDelay:           time.Second * 10,
		clusterAvailableDelay: time.Second * 20,

comments.body: I would suggest that you rather use the existing types.NamespacedName here.  But that can go in a followup PR if you prefer.
@kshafiee  @mwielgus What about the namespace?  I don't think that this controller works for secrets in namespaces?  Also, do we have any e2e tests for this controller?
